page.title: 19Transport, North Murroes
page.content: The remains of the{railway}from Broughty Ferry to Forfar, with stations at Gagie,Monikie & Kirkbuddo can still be seen. But the passenger service ceased in the 1950's with the last goods train running in 1965. Later, the area was served by{buses travelling from Dundee to Forfar or Kirriemuir. Now buses from Wellbank to Forfar have been discontinued, and have been replaced by 4 buses each day providing a circular route via Kellas or Monikie to Dundee. At present{school buses}are provided by Tayside Region, but a few years ago the service was run by Luckyslap Garage who, in the worst winter weather, would run a Land-Rover to ensure the schoolchildren got home safely through the snow.
